column11:
This table shows the Fall 2022 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It reflects the distribution of instructional activity, with graduate “extra credit” added to account for higher weighting of graduate coursework, and the conversion of credit hours into FTE enrollments.

By School (Fall 2022):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, generating 48,696 credit hours, equal to about 3,119 FTEs.

Business – produced 14,083 credit hours for 836 FTEs.

Education – a smaller contributor, with 5,253 credit hours and 143 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – delivered 9,142 credit hours, supporting 484 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – second-largest load with 32,663 credit hours, equal to 1,979 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credits taught at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – weighting applied to graduate courses.

Grand Total Credit Hours – overall teaching activity including adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – full-time equivalent enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
